The claim made by Governor Chris Christi: 2. The claim was based on a statistic recently cited by Camden Superintendent Paymon Rouhanifard, which referred to students whose SAT scores met the "SAT College and Career Readiness Benchmark" developed by the College Board.
The benchmark: a combined score of 1550 on the SAT, indicates a 65 percent likelihood of achieving a B- average or higher during a student's first year at a four-year college, according to the College Board.
The actual statistic related to the numb: graders enrolled in Camden during the 2011-12 school year who took the SATs and hit that benchmark, which was only three out of the 214 students who took the exam.
